flow.descriptionCdata:
46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.18569d0a-8292-4532-8e7d-2da5f6650197.prompt=Enter user 46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.2f0ef79c-dc09-42e0-9265-8b74be2eff2e.prompt=Enter password 46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.344d96df-3a7a-4eed-94a4-ec43811e6f31.description=
Sets the power state of virtual machine (poweredOn,poweredOff,paused). Does nothing if the virtual machine is already in the power state.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
vmPowerState - Virtual machine power state to set (poweredOn, poweredOff, suspended).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no action - The operation completed with no action performed.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task ID or task completion return message.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.7d768c67-70a0-478e-8938-7d662402b130.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.aa2e1b6b-9b37-48b4-a8ab-4a4df0a3661e.prompt=Virtual Machine name\: 46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.c90dc134-7dfe-4e1d-a932-85e785f37b2f.description=
Clone a virtual machine. The virtual machine may be a template vm. The source virtual machine is specified via vmIdentifierType and virtualMachine (optionally vmDatacenter) while the target configuration is defined by vmName,vmFolder,vmResourcePool,dataStore,hostSystem, and clusterName.

Note\: cannot work across virtual datacenters

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP
user - VMWare username
password - VMWare user's password
port - Port to connect on
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https)
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123)
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type
async - Asynchronously perform the task
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter
vmName - Virtual machine name being created (new)
vmFolder - Virtual machine's folder by inventory path, / delimited not including datacenter (eg. ManagedVMs/DRS/Location1). For root folder, use /
vmResourcePool - Virtual machine's resource pool
dataStore - Datastore (eg. host\:dsname, mydatastore)
hostSystem - Target virtual machine host system
clusterName - Name of the VMWare HA or DRS cluster
markAsTemplate - Mark the virtual machine as a template? Mark as regular virtual machine otherwise
customizationTemplateName - Customization template name to use on the existing virtual machine or on the newly created one if a new VM is being created.

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.d462f60d-5678-40a7-bc32-b6a022b7a3f4.description=Flex up a VM to the specific CPU Memory and Disk that is requested. Input Parameters\: serviceName -name of the service that will be created with this flow VCenterHost - vCenter host to execute against VCenterUsername - vCenter username VCenterPassword - vCenter password. virtualMachine - This is the virtual machine that will be flexed. vmDatacenter - target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs dataStore - target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs clusterName - target cluster for the VMs vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs cpuCount - number of cpus the virtual machine should have. memSize - amount of memory the virtual machine should have. addDisk - whether or not disk should be added to the vm. Responses\: success - if the command completes execution and its exit code is 0 failure - otherwise Result Fields\: NA 46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.description=
Create a VM from a VM template. Must specify either hostSystem, clusterName, or vmResourcePool as a target location for VMs.

Input Parameters\:
 vmName - name of the VM that will be created with this flow
 templateName -  name of the VM template to clone in vCenter
 osType - linux or windows
 host -  vCenter host to execute against
 user - vCenter username
 password - vCenter password
 vmDatacenter -  target Datacenter on the vCenter host for the VMs
 dataStore -  target datastore on the vCenter host for the VMs
 hostSystem - target ESX host for the VMs
 clusterName - target cluster for the VMs
 vmResourcePool - target resource pool for the VMs
 CPUs - Number of cpus to be set on the VMs
 Memory - Amount of Memory in MB to be set on VMs. Memory should be a multiple of 4.
 port - Port Number toconnect on
 protocol - Connection prtocol(http, https)
 availableCPU - Available CPU in  vCenter
 availableMemory - Available Memory in MB in vCenter


Responses\:
 success - The operation completed successfully.
 failure - Something went wrong.
   

Result Fields\:
 vmId - VMID of the Clone
46c26ce9-e7ec-41ce-a78f-dc6fdd731379.df8d0f58-99b4-4fd3-b7cc-d2a3c9922785.description=
Retrieve information about a virtual machine or a group of virtual machines in a datacenter or host system (pipe-delimited). Retrieve each object one at a time from an initial search query ala SQL Query operation.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation?
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type.
hostSystem - Target virtual machine host system.
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/MyResourcePool/MyVM), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
getDetailed - Retrieve detailed information?

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.
no more - there are no more results to retrieve.

Returns\:
vmInfo - Virtual machine information.
numberOfResults - Number of results from the query remaining to be retrieved.
returnResult - Virtual machine ID or operation results.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter or vSphere server the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter or vSphere client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
flow.name: vCenter Create Clone - SCL

staticBinding.value: Failed to create server with the given configuration
